TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit EntitySqlException extends System.Data.EntityException

Docs.summary: Represents errors that occur when parsing Entity SQL command text. This exception is thrown when syntactic or semantic rules are violated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about how to handle code exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception>.

Docs.param: The message that describes the error.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about how to handle code exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that caused the current exception, or a `null` reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Data.EntitySqlException"> class that uses a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about how to handle code exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception>.

Docs.summary: Gets the approximate column number where the error occurred.
Docs.value: An integer that describes the column number where the error occurred.

Docs.summary: Gets the approximate context where the error occurred, if available.
Docs.value: A string that describes the approximate context where the error occurred, if available.

Docs.summary: Gets a description of the error.
Docs.value: A string that describes the error.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void GetObjectData(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <see cref="T:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Sets the <see cref="T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"> with information about the exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `GetObjectData` sets a `SerializationInfo` with the exception object data that is targeted for serialization. During deserialization, the exception is reconstituted from the `SerializationInfo` transmitted over the stream.
For more information about how to handle code exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception>.

Docs.summary: Gets the approximate line number where the error occurred.
Docs.value: An integer that describes the line number where the error occurred.
